title: Reflex J 320
text:
The Reflex J 320 is a French <a href="paramotor">paramotor</a> that was designed by Dominique Cholou and produced by <a href="Reflex%20Paramoteur">Reflex Paramoteur</a> of <a href="Chatou">Chatou</a> for <a href="powered%20paragliding">powered paragliding</a>. Now out of production, when it was available the aircraft was supplied complete and ready-to-fly.
Design and development.
The J 320 was designed to comply with the European microlight regulations. It features a <a href="paraglider">paraglider</a>-style wing, single-place accommodation and a single <a href="JPX%20D-320">JPX D-320</a> engine in <a href="pusher%20configuration">pusher configuration</a> with a 2.38:1 ratio <a href="reduction%20drive">reduction drive</a> and a diameter three-bladed composite propeller. The fuel tank capacity is .
As is the case with all paramotors, take-off and landing is accomplished by foot. Inflight steering is accomplished via handles that actuate the canopy brakes, creating roll and yaw.
